msgSnippet: A simpler solution is just to put junit.jar ahead fo your developer s classes in your classpath. --Sameer

A simpler solution is just to put junit.jar ahead fo your developer's
classes in your classpath.

--Sameer

> Within the same package as where the MapTest.java was, existed a
> Test.class (and Test.java). The developer's Test.class did not have
> the appropriate run method, and therefore could not work.
> 
> Not that anyone would ever have this problem starting out with junit,
> but if you happen to take over code from developers and they've
> created a Test.class within the package, just delete or rename the
> Test.class and all will go back into the green.
subject: Re: [junit] (unknown)
